summary: PULLING BOAT AND TRAILER HOME FROM SUMMER HOME.  HAD GONE ABOUT 170 MILES WHEN WE CAME ACROSS BRIDGE AND THEN SUDDENLY NOTICED SMOKE COMING FROM REAR LEFT WHEEL AND TIRE TILTING LIKE IT WAS GOING TO COME OFF.  WE IMMEDIATELY PULLED OFF ROAD AND THOUGHT A BEARING HAD BROKE.  UNHOOKED TRAILER AND THEN CAME BACK WITH JACK AND TOOLS.WHEN TIRE WAS REMOVED WE NOTICED IT WAS NOT THE BEARING.  THE SPINDLE THAT WAS WELDED TO THE BRAKE PLATE THAT IS WELDED TO THE AXLE WAS BROKE CLEAN OFF.  WHEN INSPECTING THE PART IT WAS CLEAR THAT IT WAS A COLD WELD PROBLEM - THERE WAS NO PENETRATION OF THE WELD ON THE SPINDLE TO THE AXLE.  WE ONLY PULL OUR TRAILER TWICE A YEAR - TO SUMMER HOME AND BACK. OTHER TIMES TRAILER IS STORED IN CLIMATE CONTROLLED GARAGE.  WE WERE FORTUNATE THAT THIS DID NOT HAPPEN ON BUSY HIGHWAY OR THAT WHEEL DID NOT COME OFF.  WE TOOK AXLE TO CERTIFIED WELDER AND HE CONFIRMED MY FINDINGS THAT IT WAS A COLD WELD THAT FAILED.  HE WELDED AND INSPECTED OTHER SIDE TO MAKE SURE THE WELD HAD PENETRATED PROPERLY  HAD TO PUT ON NEW BRAKE SHOES BECAUSE WHEN SPINDLE BROKE IT DUG INTO BRAKE SHOE. TRAILER IS A FOUR WINNS TRAILER, BUT I DID NOT SEE THAT LISTED - ONLY SHOWED FOUR WINDS.  WAS NOT SURE WHAT COMPONENT TO LIST AS IT WAS AXLE WELD SO WE CALLED IT STRUCTURE FRAME.  ALSO, IN RESEARCHING TO SEE IF ANY OTHER PROBLEMS, THIS IS EXACTLY AS DESCRIBED ON RECALL REFERENCE #00V296000 IN 1999.  WE DID CONTACT RALPH HOSKINS AT FOUR WINNS TO SEE IF THIS INCLUDED OUR TRAILER AND BASICALLY HE BRUSHED US OFF SAYING IT WAS NOT THE SAME THING.  IT WAS CLEARLY A FAULTY WELD AND NOT DUE TO FATIGUE.  THIS WAS EVEN CONFIRMED BY CERTIFIED WELDER.  WE TOOK PICTURES SHOWING THE SPINDLE AND THE BRAKE FLANGE IF INTERESTED. *TR

UHAUL STORE PERSONNEL WAS KNOWLEDGEABLE AND ADMITTED AFTER THE FACT OF INOPERABLE MOVING TRUCK AND RENTED IT TO ME, WHICH CAUSED A BREAKDOWN AND UHAUL TRUCK HAD TO BE TOWED TO AND FROM MY PROPERTY WITH OVER 2 ROOMS OF FURNITURE TO UNLOAD BY MYSELF. *JB

THE FAILURE CONCERNED A VIKING POP-UP TRAILER, 1996 LEGEND 2380.  THE DEFECT INVOLVED THE LIFT SYSTEM.  THIS LIFT SYSTEM IS A MANUAL CABLE SYSTEM AND TWO CORNERS SNAPPED, WHICH CAUSED THE ROOF (OVER 100 LBS) TO FALL ABOUT 4 FEET  (OR TO THE LEVEL OF THE UNOPENED TRAILER).  A CO-OWNER WAS IN THE TRAILER AT THE TIME OF THE ACCIDENT AND WAS STRUCK ON THE HEAD AND NECK AS IT FELL. AFTER TALKING WITH A VIKING SERVICEMAN, WE REALIZED THAT ALL FOUR CORNERS ARE ON SAME SYSTEM, AND ALL CORNERS COULD POTENTIALLY SNAP ONE AFTER THE OTHER CAUSING THE ENTIRE ROOF TO FALL.  I CONTACTED VIKING AND WAS TOLD THAT THERE WAS NO RECALL ISSUED FOR THIS SAFETY PROBLEM, AND THEY REFUSED TO PAY FOR THE REPAIRS NEEDED TO FIX THE CABLE SYSTEM.  THEY DID HOWEVER, OFFER TO SEND SOME SUPPORT BARS TO PREVENT THIS FROM HAPPENING AGAIN.  THE CABLES ON THE LIFT SYSTEMS MANUFACTURED IN 1996 AND PREVIOUS YEARS MAY SNAP WITH NO WARNING.  NOTHING IN THE LITERATURE GIVEN TO US AT THE TIME OF PURCHASE WARNED OF THIS POSSIBILITY, AND NO SUBSEQUENT INFORMATION WAS GIVEN BY VIKING THAT SUPPORT BARS ARE NEEDED TO PREVENT THE ENTIRE ROOF FROM FALLING WITHOUT PROVOCATION.  I'M FILING THIS COMPLAINT TO HELP PREVENT THIS FROM HAPPENING TO OTHER FAMILIES WHO OWN A VIKING TRAILER WITH THIS TYPE OF LIFT SYSTEM.  ** NOTE ** COACHMAN HAS PURCHASED VIKING TRAILERS, AND I WAS UNABLE TO FIND VIKING TRAILERS AS A ITEM TO CHECK IN THE "MANUFACTURERS SECTION", SO I CHECKED "UNKNOWN".  *JB

I WAS DRIVING ON THE FREEWAY.  MY TIRE TREAD SEPARATED FROM THE TIRE. THE SEPARATION CAUSED A MOMENTARY LOSS OF CONTROL. THE TREAD DAMAGED MY VEHICLE AS IT LEFT THE REST OF THE TIRE.  THIS TIRE IS PART OF A SET OF FOUR THAT I PURCHASED FROM BIG O TIRES.  THIS IS THE SECOND OF THE FOUR TO HAVE A PROBLEM. THE FIRST HAD A SIDEWALL SPLIT JUST BELOW THE TREAD LINE. I HAPPENED TO NOTICE THAT WHILE THE VEHICLE WAS PARKED. BIG O REPLACED THAT TIRE. I HAVE CONTACTED THEM ABOUT THE TREAD SEPARATION AND THEY HAVE NO INTEREST IN MY EVENTS. IN LIGHT OF THE FIRESTONE SEPARATIONS AND DEATHS A FEW YEARS BACK I WOULD THINK THAT THEY WOULD ACTIVELY INVESTIGATE. *JB

TODAY SAT. JUNE 4 ON 65 NORTH IN INDIANA, TRUCK WITH TRAILER #53655W AND PLATE # P57280 ALMOST HIT US 2 TIMES TODAY. THE 1ST TIME WAS AT 8:50 AM WHEN WE WERE GETTING ON 65 AT TAYLORVILLE,INDIANA. HE HAD NO ONE IN THE LEFT LANE AND WOULD NOT GET OVER WE HAD TO STOP. THE 2ND TIME WAS AFTER THE EDINBURG, INDIANA EXIT WE WERE IN THE LEFT HAND LANE AND HE PULLED RIGHT OVER IN FRONT OF US MAKING US PUT ON THE BRAKES. WE HAVE TURNED OVER ALL THIS INFO ON THE TRUCK DRIVER AND THE TRUCK TO TRUCKING COMPANY LISTED ON THE TRAILER. THE TRUCK IS FROM D.L.LIBBY FROM EMINSTION,ILL. NEXT TIME HE MAY JUST CAUSE AN ACCIDENT AND SOME ONE MAY GET HURT BAD OR KILLED.
TIRE TREAD SEPARATION ON HANKOOK P195R14C MOUNTED ON TRAILER.  SERIAL NUMBER M5H487.   *NM

WATER COMES UNDER CONSUMERS FEET, ALSO HAD TO REPLACE DOOR PANEL.   *MR   THE CONSUMER HAD THE OIL CHANGED AND PAID FOR SEVERAL OIL PLUGS.  WATER HAD COME FROM UNDER THE DRIVERS FEET AND THE DEALER REPLACED A DOOR PANEL.  THE RUG CONTINUED TO GET WET.  THE CONSUMER THOUGHT THAT MAYBE THE PROBLEM WAS COMING FROM THE FENDER.  (VAN)   *SCC  *JB

LP STORAGE TANK DOES NOT HAVE ANY PROTECTION FROM WHEEL/TIRE FAILURE,OPEN TO DUAL RIGHT REAR WHEELS,ON THE END OF STORAGE TANK,MOST OTHER CLASS A RV'S DO HAVE SOME KIND  OF GUARD/COVER FOR THE LP GAS STORAGE TANK.

L/FRONT SIDE OF TRUCK HIT THE R/REAR SIDE OF A SUV, AND THEN SLID INTO A DITCH ON ITS R/SIDE AND ENDING UP ON THE L/SIDE.  THE TIRES ARE FAIRLY NEW AND NO BLOWOUT OCCURRED, BUT THE R/FRONT WAS FLAT THE FOLLOWING AM.  UPON ITS REMOVAL THE BODY FRAME SHOWS WHERE THE TIRE IMPACTED IT. DAMAGE WAS AS FOLLOWS: SUV SLIGHT INDENTATION IN FENDER AREA. PICKUP= R/FENDER PANEL BENT, FRONT BUMBER BENT, ON THE DRIVER SIDE=FRONT TIRE BODY FRAME CRUSHED, DOOR, NEXT PANEL, AND THE CARGO PANEL ALL HAVE BODY DAMAGE WHICH REQUIRES REPLACEMENTWINDSHIELD ALSO WAS CRACKED, WITH SEVERAL CRACKS JUST ABOVE WHERE LOOKING THROUGH THE WINDOW IS A TAG STATING"AIRBAG"
TWO NEW TIRES SUFFERED TREAD SEPARATION FIRST 5/31/01 SECOND 7/31/01 ON OUR HORSE TRAILER. *AK (TIRESIZE: ST225/75R1)
I HAVE HAD 3 LT235/85R16 BRIDGESTONE TIRE FAILURES IN 2 YEARS,ALL WERE CATASTROPHIC!*AK (DOT NUMBER: 7B9JPUA  TIRESIZE: LT235/85R1)
NO SUMMARY LISTED.  *AK

IN 1996 I PURCHASED THIS NEW 1996 DUTCHMEN CLASSIC TRAVEL TRAILER.  WE HAVE NEVER USED THE TRAILER - IT HAS ZERO MILES.  BUT IN THE SPRING OF 2000 MY HUSBAND'S FOOT ALMOST WENT THROUGH A SOFT SPOT IN THE CORNER OF THE KITCHEN FLOOR.  WE HIRED A CARPENTER TO CHECK IT OUT.  HE DISCOVERED SEVERAL GALLONS OF WATER TRAPPED ON THE VAPOR BARRIER THAT COVERS THE ENTIRE UNDERSTRUCTURE OF THE TRAILER.  THE WATER DAMAGE TO THE UNDERSTRUCTURE WAS EXTENSIVE THE ENTIRE LENGTH AND BREADTH OF THE TRAILER.  THE WOODEN BOTTOM PLATES WERE SOFT AND ROTTED TO THE POINT THAT THE CARPENTER BELIEVES THAT IF THIS TRAILER WERE TO BE TOWED DOWN THE ROAD, THE BOLTS THAT ATTACH THE WOOD TO THE METAL FRAME WOULD LOOSEN AND THE TRAILER WOULD FALL APART.  THIS WOULD BE A SAFETY HAZARD ON THE ROADWAYS.

TIRE SIZE LT235/85R16, LOAD RANGE E. TIRES INFLATED TO 80PSI. EXTERIOR TEMPERATURE 78 DEGREES. TWO FAILURES WITHIN 400 MILES. TREAD DELAMINATION ON 1ST TIRE. TREAD COMPLETELY SEPARATED FROM BASE (DOING DAMAGE TO UNDERCARRIAGE OF COACH). THIS TIRE RETAINED PRESSURE, HOWEVER. 2ND TIRE BLOW OUT WITHIN 5 MILES OF A COLD START. COMPLETE DESTRUCTION OF TIRE OCCURRED WITH SUBSEQUENT ADDITIONAL UNDERCARRIAGE DAMAGE TO COACH. SPEED WAS 65MPH IN BOTH CASES. THESE TIRES ARE RATED AT 3042 LBS (AT 80PSI). APPROXIMATE ACTUAL LOAD ON TIRE(S): 2400LBS. ONLY EXPERIENCED DRIVER SKILL PREVENTED LOSS OF CONTROL (AND THE FACT THAT THAT THIS WAS A 5TH WHEEL AND NOT A "BUMPER PULL" COACH). WE SUSEQUENTLY SLOWED OUR SPEED TO 55MPH WITH NO FURTHER MISHAPS (FOR 1500 ADDITIONAL MILES AFTER THE INCIDENTS). PLEASE NOTE THAT TWO TIRES (FROM THE ORIGINAL FOUR) REMAIN ON THE COACH AND WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO YOU AT YOUR REQUEST FOR FURTHER TESTING. WE FEEL THAT THESE TIRES HAD NOT BEEN ABUSED IN ANY WAY AND OUGHT TO HAVE WITHSTOOD A 65MPH TOWING SPEED REGARDLESS OF ROAD TEMPERATURE. THE FAILURES OCCURRED IN RHODE ISLAND.  *AK (TIRESIZE: 235/85R16)( DOT NUMBER:  TIRE SIZE: 235/85R16 )
TIRE TREAD SEPERATED CAUSING HEAVY DAMAGE TO TRAILER. (TIRESIZE: LT2358516E)( DOT NUMBER:  TIRE SIZE: LT2358516E )
NUMEROUS PROBLEMS SINCE 1997TO1999 TOTALING 3,232.85. NO SAFETY DEFECT LISTED IN THE SUMMARY.

BRAKES FAIL WHILE GOING SLOW/SLOWING DOWN TO MAKE A STOP.  USUALLY UNDER DAMP CONDITIONS.  THIS HAS HAPPENED PROBABLY 10 TIMES IN THE LAST YEAR.  I HAVE HAD IT CHECKED OUT AND NO ONE CAN FIND ANYTHING WRONG.  THE FIRST MECHANIC TIGHTENED THE HAND BRAKE AND THAT TOOK CARE OF THE SITUATION FOR ABOUT 6 MONTHS.  IT OCCURRED AGAIN YESTERDAY, I HAD IT CHECKED OUT BY ANOTHER MECHANIC--NOTHING WRONG.  THE MANAGER SUGGESTED I SEE IF THIS PROBLEM WAS UNDER RECALL.  *AK

JEEP VEHICLE (1) WAS HEADING NORTH BOUND, WHILE DRIVING AT 35MPH, ENTERING AN INTERSECTION, ANOTHER TRUCK VEHICLE (2) GOING WESTBOUND, HIT JEEP ON PASSENGERS SIDE.  JEEP WAS THROWN ONTO ONGOING TRAFFIC GOING SOUTHBOUND TRAFFIC.  JEEP HIT TRUCK (3) (BREAD TRUCK) HEAD ON.  VEHICLE TRUCK (3) HIT ANOTHER VEHICLE TRUCK (4) THAT WAS NEXT TO EACH OTHER.  .  BOTH VEHICLE (3) AND VEHICLE (4) WERE NEXT TO EACH OTHER HEADING SOUTHBOUND.  UPON IMPACT, AIR BAG DID NOT DEPLOY, AIR BAG RESTRAINT SYSTEM FAILED.  SAFETY BELT DID NOT HOLD DRIVER IN.  DRIVER SUFFERED BROKEN STERNUM IN (2) PLACES, BLOOD CLOT BEHIND STERNUM, LEG TRAUMA, STOMACH PROBLEMS AND NECK PROBLEMS.  THE JEEP HAD FRONTAL DAMAGE INCLUDING HOOD AND WINDSHIELD.  JEEP HAD SIDE DAMAGE.  THE GEAR SHIFTS ALSO CAME OUT OF PLACE.  JEEP WAS TOTALLED OUT.  *AK( DOT NUMBER: NA TIRE SIZE: P225/70R16 )
NO SUMMARY

I HAVE CONTACTED MY LOCAL DEALER, THE DEALER WHERE I PURCHASED THE M/C AND DUCATI MOTORS U.S.A AND CAN GET NO RESPONCE REGARDING RECALL CAMPAIGN # 99V-047.  PLEASE ADVISE OR HELP WITH THIS SITUATION.  THANK YOU.
BRACKET THAT HOLDS THE SEAT TO THE ADJUSTING RAIL FAILED.  IF THIS WERE TO HAPPEN WHILE THE VEHICLE WAS IN MOTION COULD CAUSE ACCIDENT.
WIPERS STOP WORKING WHILE ON RESULTING IN A GRINDING NOISE. WILL COME BACK ON LATER.
CRUISE CONTROL FAILED TO RELEASE THE THROTTLE UNDER ANY CONDITION, BRAKES, SHUT-OFF SWITHCH, OR IGNITION SWITCH.  VERY HAZARDOUS FOR EXITING INTERSTATE OR NEEDING TO SLOW OR STOP!
VEHICLE HAS FRONT END PROBLEM.  YH
HEATER CIRCUIT BOARD FAILED.
